availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Gun manufacturing company in Meriden, Connecticut. Operated from 1828 to 1868. Operated as Meriden Machine Company from 1828 to 1860. Operated as Parker, Snow, Brooks & Company from 1860 to 1865. Operated as Meriden Manufacturing Company from 1865 to 1868. Operated as Parker Brothers from 1868. Partners: Charles Parker, Gamaliel F. Snow, and James S. Brooks.

ab.bibl: George D. Moller, American Military Shoulder Arms, Volume 3: Flintlock Alterations and Muzzleloading Percussion Shoulder Arms, 1840-1865 (Albuquerque: University of New Mexico Press, 2011), p. 257.252.
